definition: to cause havoc/to run amok
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
variant of 鬧|闹[nao4]
noisy/cacophonous/to make noise/to disturb/to vent (feelings)/to fall ill/to have an attack (of sickness)/to go in (for some activity)/to joke
to shout and scream (idiom); to kick up a fuss/to make a scene
Monkey Wreaks Havoc in Heaven, story about the Monkey King Sun Wukong 孫悟空|孙悟空[Sun1 Wu4 kong1] from the novel Journey to the West 西遊記|西游记

sentences.english: We had a famous set-to at rat-hunting all the morning in my father's great barns;
sentences.chinese: 我们在我父亲的大谷仓里逮老鼠，大闹了一个上午。

sentences.english: Yuxiang assumed Aishan has been seduced by Youli and created a commotion inside his house.
sentences.chinese: 玉香以为爱善被有礼勾引到屋里，冲到有礼家大闹。

sentences.english: By Sunday morning, I was so angry with Dr.
sentences.chinese: 但是周日清晨，我对贺博士大闹肝火，我想离开。

sentences.english: She had turned seriously nasty over a handsome yale boy .
sentences.chinese: 她为了一个漂亮的耶鲁大学生真的大闹了一场。

sentences.english: When he finds out you broke his glass, he will raise the devil.
sentences.chinese: 一旦他发现你弄坏了他的玻璃杯，他准会大闹一番。

sentences.english: On the other hand, Mingming's father creates trouble at Huixin's wedding ceremony, but is stopped by Shuibo.
sentences.chinese: 明明的父亲又到蕙心的婚礼大闹，却被水波赶走。

sentences.english: Indeed as expected FengZeYuan havent open the door, a group of beggars make blocked the door.
sentences.chinese: 果然丰泽园还没开门，一帮乞丐堵住门口大闹。

sentences.english: Martian Body Count" opened this week! It's the prequel to "Doctor Decimator Atomizes Mars.
sentences.chinese: 火星威龙“这周上映是”博士杀人狂大闹火星的前传。

sentences.english: He wanted to return the insult, but bit his lips in order to avoid a scene.
sentences.chinese: 他本想回骂，但咬咬嘴唇以免当众大闹。

definition: to cause trouble/to create a disturbance
to shout and scream (idiom); to kick up a fuss/to make a scene
to beat viciously
to be furious/to fly into a terrible rage
variant of 鬧|闹[nao4]
noisy/cacophonous/to make noise/to disturb/to vent (feelings)/to fall ill/to have an attack (of sickness)/to go in (for some activity)/to joke
to beat sb soundly
gongs and drums overture to a Chinese opera/to create a disturbance
to cause trouble/to provoke a dispute
to make an unreasonable scene
to provoke anger
lit. chickens flying and dogs jumping (idiom)/fig. in chaos/in disarray
to have a falling out/to have a big argument
farce/CL:場|场[chang3],齣|出[chu1],幕[mu4]
stamp with fury/fly into a rage
to chase and beat
to create a big disturbance
